attributes.action: scrap the introduction of compulsory ID cards and use the money saved to increase the size of the Police Service, fund it properly, and pay policemen what they are worth
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The costs of the proposed ID cards are literally incalculable by this government.  But it will be a huge amount of money got from taxpayers one way or another.  And there is no evidence that they will increase security.  A much larger, more visible Police Service would.  And Police Officers, who put themseves in harms way so that we are not, should be paid a lot more money.  The savings to be had by scrapping the proposed ID cards would make both possible

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to " scrap the introduction of compulsory ID cards and use the money saved to increase the size of the Police Service, fund it properly, and pay policemen what they are worth."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page16660


Prime Minister's Office
